result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph D Brumfield

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph D Brumfield in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Joseph D Brumfield in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Upon plea to Cts 1 & 3 from original information, Cts 2 & 4 are DRI and 14CF1239 is DRI. The State recommends 18 mos IC, 30 mos ES conc with each other and conc with 13CF1092.
P-G to both
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. SEH to be set out  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph D Brumfield in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Joseph D Brumfield in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The Court has also received a motion to vacate plea agreement due to illegal recommendation. Defense objects as they do not believe the State has jurisdiction to bring said motion. Defense also indicates that the deft wishes to go forward today and he waives any kinds of objections  or problems that may be available to the Court. The State indicates they believe the amended information must be vacated and a new plea agreement made. The State indicates they do not have a new information but rely on the original information.

BTC: The plea agreement was an illegal impossibility. Plea is vacated and parties are to renegotiate.  The dismissal in 14CF1239 is also vacated  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph D Brumfield in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Joseph D Brumfield in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court Reporter: Marilyn Leedle.  Transcript filed: 4-24-2015 AR
Amended information filed in 14CF1222.  Reading waived; not guilty plea entered.
State's offer and recommendation:  Plea previously entered in 13CF1092.  Plea to Count 1 of amended information in 14CF1222, recommend 18 mos WPS 30 mos ES cs to 13CF1092.  Plea to count 3; recommend concurrent time .  All remaining counts to be dismissed and read-in as is 14CF1239 in its' entirety.
Court colloquy re rights being waived, elements of crimes and possible penalties.  
Defendant stipulates to understanding.
State consents to jury waiver.  
PLEA - guilty to each of 2 charges
06CF1229 - prior conviction; defendant confirms prior conviction
Finding and judgment of guilt.  Court finds plea entered freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently.
PSI update  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 03-27-2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Joseph D Brumfield in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Joseph D Brumfield in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
  Plea hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for November 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2014 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Joseph D Brumfield in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Sharon A. Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
State's offer put on the record  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2014 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 11, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Joseph D Brumfield in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Joseph D Brumfield in custody.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 09:00 am.
